state_summary: Rodney Brooks, iRobot founder, warns of a humanoid robot investment bubble due to lack of dexterity and fine motor movements.
evidence: Billions of venture dollars being poured into humanoid robot companies
Humanoids won’t be able to learn dexterity — or the fine motor movements with hands — rendering them essentially useless
Multiple robotics-focused VCs and AI scientists don't expect wide adoption of humanoid robots for at least a few years, if not more than a decade
